jfxtras.labs.dialogs

Class MonologFX

  • java.lang.Object
    • jfxtras.labs.dialogs.MonologFX

  • public class MonologFX
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MonologFX.ButtonAlignment 
      static class  MonologFX.Type
      Type of dialog box is one of the following, each with a distinct icon: <p> ACCEPT = check mark icon <p> ERROR = red 'X' icon <p> INFO = blue 'i' (information) icon <p> QUESTION = blue question mark icon <p> If no type is specified in the constructor, the default is INFO.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MonologFX()
      Default constructor for a MonologFX dialog box.
      MonologFX(MonologFX.Type t)
      Constructor for a MonologFX dialog box that accepts one of the enumerated types listed above.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonologFX

        public MonologFX()

        Default constructor for a MonologFX dialog box. Creates an INFO box.

        See Also:
        MonologFX.Type

      • MonologFX

        public MonologFX(MonologFX.Type t)

        Constructor for a MonologFX dialog box that accepts one of the enumerated types listed above.

        Parameters:
        t - The type of MonologFX dialog box to create.
        See Also:
        MonologFX.Type

    • Method Detail

      • addButton

        public void addButton(MonologFXButton btnToAdd)

        Public method used to add a button to a MonologFX dialog.

        Parameters:
        btnToAdd - A MonologFXButton object.
        See Also:
        MonologFXButton

      • addStylesheet

        public void addStylesheet(java.lang.String stylesheet)

        Allows developer to add stylesheet for MonologFX dialog, supplementing or overriding existing styling.

        Parameters:
        stylesheet - String variable containing the path/name of the stylesheet to apply to the dialog’s scene and contained controls.

      • setButtonAlignment

        public void setButtonAlignment(MonologFX.ButtonAlignment buttonAlignment)

        Sets the button alignment for the MonologFX dialog box. Default is CENTER.

        Parameters:
        buttonAlignment - Valid values are LEFT, RIGHT, and CENTER.
        See Also:
        MonologFX.ButtonAlignment

      • setDisplayTime

        public void setDisplayTime(int displayTime)

        Sets the display time for the MonologFX dialog box. Default is 10 seconds.

        Parameters:
        displayTime - Valid values are any integer value.

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String msg)

        Sets the text displayed within the MonologFX dialog box. Word wrap ensures that all text is displayed.

        Parameters:
        msg - String variable containing the text to display.

      • setModal

        public void setModal(boolean isModal)

        Sets the modality of the MonologFX dialog box.

        Parameters:
        isModal - Boolean. A true value = APPLICATION_MODAL, false = NONE.

      • setTitleText

        public void setTitleText(java.lang.String title)

        Sets the text displayed in the title bar of the MonologFX dialog box.

        Parameters:
        title - String containing the text to place in the title bar.

      • setType

        public void setType(MonologFX.Type typeToSet)

        Sets the Type of MonologFX dialog box to display.

        Parameters:
        typeToSet - One of the supported types of dialogs.
        See Also:
        MonologFX.Type

      • setPos

        public void setPos(double x,
                   double y)

        Sets the coordinates of the MonologFX dialog.

        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the dialog.
        y - The y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the dialog.

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)

        Sets the x coordinate of the MonologFX dialog.

        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the dialog.

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)

        Sets the y coordinate of the MonologFX dialog.

        Parameters:
        y - The y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the dialog.

      • showDialog

        public MonologFXButton.Type showDialog()
        Deprecated. Please use show() instead.

        Displays the MonologFX dialog box and waits for user input.

        Returns:
        The type of the button pressed.
        See Also:
        MonologFXButton.Type, show()

      • show

        public MonologFXButton.Type show()

        Displays the MonologFX dialog box and waits for user input.

        Returns:
        The type of the button pressed.
